meanings.definition: To dig up (a body) from the ground.
meanings.sent1: The archaeologist had to disinter the ancient remains carefully.
meanings.sent2: The cemetery workers had to disinter the coffin to move it to a different location.
meanings.sent3: It was quite a sight to see them disinter the buried treasure chest in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: The past can sometimes disinter painful memories we thought were buried deep.
meanings.sent5: The detective had to disinter the evidence to solve the cold case.

meanings.sent1: The journalist worked hard to disinter the truth behind the scandal.
meanings.sent2: The documentary aimed to disinter the hidden history of the town.
meanings.sent3: It was like a game of hide and seek to disinter the secret recipe from the old cookbook.
meanings.sent4: Her research helped disinter the forgotten stories of the war heroes.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work sought to disinter the beauty in everyday objects.
